Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel. Give it a try. Can't beat the price.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: We found this little jem after being ripped off and put out by the hotel Eden. We were treated by Fernando who took great care with us. Felt very safe and rooms wer clean and close to everything. Owner Marco is a delight. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, difficult to find.”
Reviews.Author: PerthGirl11
Reviews.Content: We spent over 20 mins trying to find this place while on the correct street. There is no signage and no one in the area could assist us where to go. When you get to the street look for the big green doors on what looks like an office/government building. There name is also written as one of the buzzers on the door, but again tiny. Accomodation is nice and clean. Room was of a quite decent size and is clean and well equipt. Breakfast was delivered to your room and is a basic crossoint, tea is extra. Great location near trevi and some great little resturants, felt like a very safe area even at night. No street noise at night, although you will get woken up quite early with scooters parking right outside the window if you have a street view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but minute single rooms”
Reviews.Author: NTSFriend
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on business. I suppose its ok if one just needs a bed to sleep. Didn't find it particularly "quaint", in fact the entrance looks dismal and you think you enter some government building. Single rooms are tiny, in fact minute, and nothing more than luxury store cupboards. Bed was comfortable, a/c didn't work, hit water didn't work. Bathroom equally tiny but clean and quite ok, no bath products apart from a tiny bar of soap. Minimal contains a bottle of water. View from room into a dismal backstreet. TV has hundreds of channels n virtually all Italian and the few English are scrambled. I don't want to sound too negative - the old receptionist was lovely (only person I saw in the hotel), but for that price I would have expected a little more - even in expensive Rome. Hotel 10 minutes from Fontana Di Trevi, Palo Barberini is next door, 15 minutes to Guard Vented, Villa Borghese and gardens, and 15 min from Stationed Termini Railway Station. All right in the heart of Rome. City tours start at Piazza Barberini 2 min from the hotel. Loads of restaurants, cafes, bars. Based on the single room experience I would recommend this for the budget business guy or individual tourist which just needs a bed to sleep - unless the double rooms are anything close to the official photos, go somewhere else for a romantic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, get what you pay for, would stay again front desk very nice and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Goalie pulled
Reviews.Content: First time to Rome. Location is great for walking to everything. Not well marked just look for green door with call box, you'll be fine. Friendly staff, clean but small room, quiet, would stay here again. Did not find a better hotel when searching in this area once we got here, for a better price or cleanliness or service.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm... good location”
Reviews.Author: buenviaje123
Reviews.Content: To begin with, this hotel is a few blocks from Termini. We decided to walk from the station to the hotel thinking it wasn't going to be that bad. Well.... the hotel has no sign whatsoever signaling where it is, or could be. Just search for a huge green door after you pass the four fountains. The room and bathroom were clean. The breakfast was also good. It had a great location for our travel purposes (tourism). Our shower was a bit clogged.... but oh well! things happen... :)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel close to Rome attractions.”
Reviews.Author: elpenguin
Reviews.Content: Nice little family-run hotel located up a steep street near Barberini Plaza. There is no sign for the hotel, just a big green door and a call box to its right that you have to access in order to be let in. We had no trouble finding the hotel. It's a great location. If you continue up the hill you can walk to Santa Maria Maggiore; across Barberini you find the Spanish Steps; around the corner from Barberini you go up to Galleria Borghese. Plus, you're near the metro if you don't want to walk all the way to St. Peter's. The street is called 4 Fountains because at the top of the hill there are, well, four pretty fountains. The room was a decent size for being a small hotel; the bathroom was great, a huge bathtub, excellent water pressure, and enough space to put your belongings. The bed was firm, as usual for European hotels, and there was a giant wardrobe and plenty of space to throw your bags and maps and things. Air-con worked great, which we needed during the evening. The breakfast was sad, but after eating such huge meals and gelato during the day, we didn't really care. The coffee was instant coffee. Rome is super-expensive for us Americans; plus you have to pay a tax in cash when you depart. In short, great little hotel. I'd come back. Pros- *great location. The street is quiet at night, and I wouldn't want to stay right near a tourist attraction for fear of freaks and noise. Some other Roman hotels are too close to fountains and piazzas, so you'd get lots of thru traffic. Here you're still close but a bit away from the hustle and bustle. *friendly owner *giant bathroom and great shower/bath, good water pressure *I felt very safe here; I'd recommend taking your passport and electronics with you. Cons- *the hill is steep (I don't mind at all because I like to burn calories when I'm eating such rich food) *the breakfast (who cares though.. see above)

Reviews.Title: “Best Service!!”
Reviews.Author: lgblack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at H 2000 Roma with two friends in December 2010. Everyone who worked there was so nice and helpful! The rooms were comfortable. Location was great. We were brought breakfast every morning by the sweetest consierge! Would stay there again and definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and good location”
Reviews.Author: AndreMiguel
Reviews.Content: Hotel H2000 is a very interesting option if you want to reach Fontana di Trevi and the center of Rome quickly. The clerk is a very pleasant Sir, who stays there almost every time and allows for some intimacy during the stay. You can also take some tips with him about transportation and visit hours of museums and archeological locations in Rome. The breakfast is brought to the room, since there is no kitchen and restaurant in the hotel; that is because it is not so great for whom is hungry soon after waking up. Actually it is a little hotel, which stays inside a building together with Quebec's office. In contrary to other reviews this year, we found the hotel very easily. The great tip to arrive to the hotel is to ask for the "Quattre Fontane", which are 50 m down from its entrance. The service is very efficient, the rooms are cleaned every day, and there is no reason for fearing about allergies (my wife is very atopic and suffers with carpets) because everything is very suitable for every kind of people. There is a free Wi-fi internet available, which is very good for people taking computers on the travel. Only in the last day, we asked for a taxi to go to the airport, and a driver (called by the hotel psersonnel) had set 50 euros to do the service, but asked for 60 euros after arriving to the airport. It is better to combine with some official taxi driver - Comuna di Rome. Finally, it is a good option for a good location and reasonable comfort in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Uncompromising”
Reviews.Author: mack243SouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Finding this hotel is very difficult. Location is not bad with good access to Barbarinni Square and the Metro. Owner charged us for having 3 people in the room when we had only 2. He spoke no English and was no help. Internet was broken if it was ever available as the registration indicated. We found an internet cafe about a half mile away.

Reviews.Title: “great location ,but hard to find”
Reviews.Author: renfrewdave
Reviews.Content: ideal location for sight seeing, metro, within walking distance for tourist attractions such as spanish steps, trevi fountain. rooms were clean, tidy no issues with theft as reported in previous reviews (never seen them before our stay!). with a big tap also in the bathroom! But trying to find the hotel for the 1st time is hard as no signage on the outside of the building except for a name on the secure entry system of the apartment block the hotel is situated in. the hotel is situated on the grd floor. if your arriving at the hotel from the barberine metro stop walk up Via del Quattro fontane on the left hand side and the hotel is just past the Barberine art gallery . approx a 5 min walk with cases. you could trek up and down the whole road looking for it. if you come to a cross roads after the Barberine art gallery you have gone too far. if your looking for it on street finder the apartment block has a dark green door. Breakfast each morning was a lottery, it became funny trying to guess what variation of the set breakfast that would arrive. but what ever came tasted great. guess it just added to the holiday! We had no issue with street noise during the rush hour or late night as the double/triple glazzing seems to do its job. mini bar stocked with water, no price list though 2 euro a bottle, though small shop open across the road. Staff were helpful and polite. Hotel is good value for money considering the location and rome prices Would go back and stay agan. The area itself is safe and clean. The tour bus stop is also beside the barberine metro in the sq. various bars and resturants nearby also from local types to the hard rock cafe with some open to 2am We found a great little place for food/drinks a couple of mintues from the hotel, on Via Resalla, 3/4 the way down the hill on the left the bar/restarant Albrecht. good value set menu , 3 course for 15 euros, service is brilliant by rome standards also!. They have the local football on the tv in the back, football, beer, pizza great chill out time. plenty of locals also seem to eat here as well. again if looking for it on street finder the place has been cleaned up since the view was taken.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Travelforfun038
Reviews.Content: Thank god my husband and I only planned on staying here one night prior to the end of our trip. The hotel is not clearly marked and spans the space of one hallway. There is one old man (out of a creepy movie) who works at the front desk and never leaves. He barely speaks English and tried to rip us off at the end of the trip when we asked for him to arrange a TAXI for us to get to the airport in the morning. In the morning a carservice came in to take our belonging and my husband watched the old man behind the desk and the car service driver exchange money. We obviously refused to drive in this car and the the driver cursed us out and went back inside in a huff. The hotel itself is tiny and dirty. Our comforter had holes in it and was dirty and the hotel reeked of cigarette smoke. The shower in the bathroom did not drain and the water subsequently went over onto the floor of the bathroom. The hotel looks out onto a parking lot. We did not eat the in house breakfast provided because we were concerned about the quality of the food and getting sick. The hotel indicates that it is near the spanish steps and the trevi fountain, however, it must be noted that you have to walk up a fairly big hill at the end of the day (which may be difficult after a day of sightseeing). I would have preferred to stay closer than a 15 minute walk away from everything. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you don't speak Italian!”
Reviews.Author: kermit_the_frog1978
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in dumpy hotels around the world, and in general, I do not have particularly picky standards. However, much of the criticism left by other people is spot on about this hotel. The hotel is permeated with cigarette smoke and if you have allergies, your stay could very well be miserable. Regardless of what the hotel manager said, the smoke was clearly coming through the window of my room from his smoking down below. The other reviewers' reports of thefts are of great concern to me; I kept my stuff locked up tight so didn't have any problems with that. The biggest problem is that the staff does not speak English, leaving you wondering what the heck they are thinking. Likewise, the main manager is not very responsive and if there had been a problem, I don't know what I would have done. Trust me, I understand it is Italy and they can speak whatever language they want in their country, but they shouldn't advertise English speaking staff when they don't. If you are fluent in Italian, allowing you to communicate with the staff and don't mind cigarette smoke--which fills the hotel, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Theft in the Room”
Reviews.Author: kirpich99
Reviews.Content: My ipod was stolen from my room. I now notice this is the third review in a row which is reporting a robbery. Maybe there is a new maid, maybe the owner is going through tough time and decided to help himself to visitors' stuff, but the fact is: if you stay in this hotel, there is a very high probability that you will be robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in Hotel Room also!”
Reviews.Author: DanijelaDelft
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel for 4 days last summer with my friend. It was a bit of a problem to find the place since it was not clearly marked. The biggest horror was that we were robbed in our hotel room. Luckily, only some of our clothes were taken. I saw another comment about the robbery from sugarcube1 where much more valuable stuff were missing. Like in the experience of sugarcube1, the guy at the desk (Fernando) was highly suspicious. When we told him what happened he suddenly started not to speak English, when my friend wanted to call the embassy and the police he was also trying to stop that ... Another thing which was annoying (but nothing compared to being robbed) was that we were told that the receptionist is there 24h per day, but when we came to the hotel one evening around 1am we were left outside to ring for almost 1 hour! Finally, obviously just got out of the bed, Fernando appeared not looking very friendly at us. For the rest it was ok... the room was nice, the location is nice.... But nothing can be good enough knowing that there is a big risk to be robbed there. And as I see here in the reviews, we are not the only one.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: sugarcube1
Reviews.Content: Most horrible experience ever. Prepaid through Expedia.ca for 3 nights 4 day stay, for a family of 4 people. By the second night, I realised that my jewellery, wallet (with $300US, debit and student card), and camera were stolen. According to the front desk attendant (Fernando), the only person who accesses the rooms was the cleaning lady, Tatianna. Up until that night, I had everything with me, but that second night my packback was ransacked, as well as my luggage, with those three items wrongfully taken from me. To add insult to injury, when we told Fernando what happened, he told us to keep it down, not wanting the other guests to find out about our crisis. For some time he also refused to hand us the phonebook (to read about how to make international calls). Fernando was listening to personal phone calls made in our room because there was a lot of feedback while we were talking to the authorities and the Embassy. When we returned to the reception desk, Fernando asked us to provide our home address as well as the location of where my family would be staying the last two days we were in Rome (because obviously we didn't want to stay in their hotel any longer). Fernando told us he would send my family a package with all the missing items to our new hotel. These lies continued (when I phoned him to ask and check up on our items). He kept changing the return date. As of today, I have not received anything from him or the hotel. Do not stay in this hotel, you are asking to be robbed!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: studyabroadhoya
Reviews.Content: In a ten-day trip from Barcelona to Paris to Geneva to Florence to Rome, we paid the most for this horrible hotel. We booked the room for two people, as that is how many we originally were supposed to have, but due to a change in plans had three people. This was the first and only place ever to give us a hard time. We ever inquired if we could pay extra to be moved to a triple (on top of 180USD per night) but they had no availability. What, then, did they have to gain from freaking out? The guy at the desk was so rude he made my sister cry ("YOU SLEEP THREE PEOPLE, BIG TROUBLE") and upon check-out, demanded an extra 40USD from my father. My father capitulated because the guy was such a jerk and so insistent, bringing the grand totel for this ridiculous hotel to 220USD. Were this the last hotel in Rome and I already had a plane ticket, I would not stay here again. While the rooms were okay (ours was at least clean though tiny by European standards), the set-up of the hotel was bizarre. It is situated in a larger complex, such that there are not even signs or markings of the hotel on the outside. The only indication was its name printed on one of the buzzers for entrance. Also, our room overlooked a parking lot and, as I recall, a garage or covered parking, so street noise was at times a problem. And this last thing is a minor issue but a nuisance at the time: the phone ringing actually sounded like a fire alarm, both in decibel level and tone. When the front desk called to tell us the cab was there, I thought the hotel was burning down.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jo H
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 10 minutes walk from Temini Station, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Colesseum and Vatican City also within walking distance. Hotel not much to look at from the outside but room fanstastic, clean and spacious and everything you needed. Big bathroom with a Jaccuzi bath which was fantastic. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Small breakfast of a crossiant and yogurt and pot of tea, a good start to the day, served in the room. Would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't worth the money we paid”
Reviews.Author: rometurist
Reviews.Content: The room was small, could be cleaner (the bed cover was dirty and had several wholes in the back, some dust). There is no bar, no lounge, nothing besides the rooms, as far as we could see. Breakfast was very, very poor. In booked expecting a jacuzzy, as announced, and in fact there was a broken jacuzzy in the bathroom; we asked to be moved to other room, and we were told ALL jacuzzis were broken and would only be fixed when we leave!! Minibar had only 3 bottles of water. We felt deceived, no discount in the payment.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest DIVE I've Ever Seen!”
Reviews.Author: rentiu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel H2000 Roma in May 2006. We stayed in a single room on the ground floor next to the front desk, with a view to the Interior court. We asked for a NON-Smoking room at the time we made the bookings. Staff was pleasant when we arrived. HOWEVER: During the 1st night, our room got filled with smoke, to the point where my eyes were burning. I went to the front desk and asked the night clerk - some guy pushing 60's - what was going on. His explanation was that most likely the rooms across the hall are smoking rooms and smoke from those rooms has sipped into our room. NOT EXACTLY....He was basically lying to my face. Between the front desk and our room was the employee lunch room. During the night, he would go in this room and chain SMOKE. Since he also had advanced Chronic Bronchitis he would cough and hack his lungs out all night long and as you guess, I could hear it loud and clear in our room. hmmmm really really impressive for the 1st night... Also the reason you get your food delivered to your room is that they have NO LUNCH room. 1st cup of coffee is free, but if you want an additional one...you have to pay for it... Needles to say next day we checked out of this dive, went across the street and checked into Hotel Barberini. (Great Hotel!) From then on we enjoyed the rest of the stay in Rome and we had a fabulous time. Portland, Oregon.

Reviews.Title: “In Rome, this is value for money!”
Reviews.Author: synnae
Reviews.Content: In reply to some other reviews, real estate prices in central Rome are at a premium, consequently hotel prices will follow. These rooms are not big, but as my part-Italian friend also noted, for Rome (or any other major European city) standards you are getting a very good deal. Our room on the first floor had what we needed, enough space for all our luggage and shopping, AC, a tv and telephone and to our surprise the biggest bathroom we encountered on our whole Italian trip. Marble, with a massive shower and massive waterfall effect shower head! We had no problem with noise, our room was at back overlooking the inner courtyard. Not a very nice view btw but that is not why I came to Rome, to sit in my hotel all day. Breakfast is small (coffee and cerial/croissant) but enough to get you started. The hotel staff is helpful as well. The location is very good, the hotel is in a safe area, it is close to the underground and within walking distance of the trevi fontain, the spanish steps and the main shopping street. Central Rome is not that big anyway and you can walk pretty much to all the tourist sights. If you are going to Rome for a short trip, I recommend this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough, especially considering the price and location”
Reviews.Author: bguy24
Reviews.Content: First use a rome map to find the hotel, we used the map off of hotels(--) at first and the street the hotel is on looks like its connects with a major street off the train station. After 30 minutes of walking up and down the street we got a Rome street map and the two streets never connect. Its about a 15 minute walk from the train stration and is in great location. Quick walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, and an easy walk to the Forum. The subway is 2 mins away to get to the train station or the Vatican. We only paid $139 a night and the size of the room is a big for a European hotel. The people we friendly, could speak decent English and help orinate us to the city. Don't expect much with the free breakfast, its a coffee or jucie and a bagel. Also there is no sign in front, all there is is the name of the hotel on a call box outside the entrance, also know the difference between civil street numbers and residential. The room was very clean, an excellent hotel with good service. Location, price and size make it a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diane61
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very comfortable and spacious. We traveled with three young children and had plenty of room. The bathroom was very large and clean. Breakfast was served in your room which was nice because we did not have to rush out in the morning. The hotel was centrally located. Very close to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. But we still walked everywhere from the hotel (colliseum and the vatican) although longer walks. The staff was very nice and helpful in providing us information as to where to eat and what to see. A VERY safe location. As for the other review regarding the noise we had no issue, even with our kids. The noise was the noise of Rome; thats it. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waist your money!”
Reviews.Author: travel48
Reviews.Content: The H2000 was a 0! We never got the room we paid for. Our double room was not availabe the first night we arrived so the hotel manager had to put us in a single room on the ground floor with street noise all night. He promised the next night he would put us in a really nice room. This never happened. He claimed the room was still not available and we would have to spend one more night in the small noisy room next the street and the front sdesk with the phone. My wife almost came to tears when he told us the news. We heard every phone call that night and did not sleep. After complaining he moved us to another small single room away from the street. But, our room was still noisy, smelled like smoke, really small and the toilet was broken. They where not very understanding either. We paid for a double and got a single and I wish we could have just left but he told us we would not be refunded. On top of all the problems he even charged me 18 euros for three warm bottles of water that we drank during our stay. Please look else where. I made a big mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mildrilla
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, well equiped, clean, and quiet. Perfect location. Close to Piazza Barberini where you can get the Metro, Bus or Stop n' Go; close to Fontana di Trevi. Staff was extremely helpful and kind. Breakfast too light, but it is brought to your room; no dining area.

HotelInfo.Name: H 2000 Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via delle Quattro Fontane, 16, 00184 Rome, Italy
